title: B-field due to current carrying wire

content.question: The long, straight wire of radius <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> carries a current <math alttext="I" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> that is uniformly distributed over its cross-sectional area. Which of the following graphs best represents the magnitude of the magnetic field <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of distance <math alttext="r " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> from the axis of the wire?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph with a horizontal axis labeled r, and a vertical axis labeled B. A vertical line, labeled R, extends from approximately halfway across the horizontal axis and ends two thirds of the way up the vertical axis. The graphed line begins at the top of the vertical line labeled R, and moves gradually downward and to the right, ending at the rightmost point on the horizontal axis and approximately one third of the way up the vertical axis.
